programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 12 Kentucky (14-5, 3-3) dropped its last two games, but won three of the last four meetings, including an 85-81 road win last season; No. 8 Tennessee (17-3, 4-3) is 11-0 at home behind Chaz Lanier, who is fourth in the SEC with 18 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: North Carolina (13-8, 6-3) is 5-6 away from home, but won both meetings with the Panthers last season after a 72-65 win in the ACC Tournament; Pittsburgh (13-6, 4-4) ended a four-game skid with a 77-73 win over Syracuse, and is 9-2 at home.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: New York and Denver split wins in 2023-24 at one apiece, with the Nuggets claiming a 113-100 win in the final matchup on March 21, led by Michael Porter Jr.'s 31 points; Jalen Brunson posted 26 points and 9 assists for the Knicks in the loss.

programme.desc: Oklahoma City and Golden State split wins in their first two meetings of the 2024-25 season with the Thunder claiming a 105-101 victory in the most recent matchup on Nov. 27; Shai Gilgeous Alexander posted 35 points and 9 rebounds for OKC in the win.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Baylor (13-6, 5-3) won its last two games after a 76-61 win over Utah behind 22 points and 12 rebounds from Norchad Omier; BYU (13-6, 3-4) is 10-1 at home this season behind Richie Saunders, who leads the Cougars in scoring with 14.9 ppg.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Oregon State (16-6, 6-3) won four of its last five, including a 97-89 OT win over the Bulldogs on Jan. 16 behind 29 points from Michael Rataj, who is third in the WCC with 18 ppg; Gonzaga (15-6, 6-2) is 8-1 at home this season behind Graham Ike.

programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.desc: The life and career of Eugene F. "Buddy" Teevens III is celebrated, showcasing the groundbreaking innovations he brought to college football during his coaching tenure which spanned four decades and the impact he made off the field.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Toledo (11-8, 5-2) won 11 of its last 12 meetings with the Bobcats, including an 86-77 road win last season; Ohio (11-8, 5-2) won seven of its last nine games, and is 8-0 at home behind AJ Clayton, who leads the team with 15.5 ppg.

programme.desc: Kelvin Gastelum (15-3) won his last two bouts since losing to Chris Weidman at UFC on Fox 25, as he faces Israel Adesanya (16-0), who looks to stay undefeated after beating Anderson Silva, for the interim UFC Middleweight Championship at UFC 236.

programme.desc: The household names of the middleweight division are examined and explored, featuring highlights from the best matches between legendary fighters, a breakdown of preferred styles, and newcomers taking on veterans for glory.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Oklahoma and LSU last met on Dec. 7, 2019, where the Sooner claimed a 90-68 victory over the Tigers behind 21 points and 2 steals from Taylor Robertson; Khayla Pointer posted 24 points and 3 assists for LSU in the defeat away from home.

programme.title: WNBA Free Agency Special
programme.desc: All of the latest news and reports surrounding the WNBA offseason are explored, including updates on the prized free agents in the class; coverage includes exclusive interviews, in-depth reports from correspondents and expert analysis.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Main event bouts from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged between longtime rivals and impressive victories are featured.

programme.title: UFC Countdown
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at fighter training camps as they prepare for their marquee matchups on pay-per-view or other televised events to show how they train for the fight, and interviews with the fighters give a look inside the fighter's mind.

programme.title: The Domonique Foxworth Show
programme.desc: Former NFL cornerback Domonique Foxworth shares his thoughts on the latest news making headlines from the sport he played, along with reactions to latest around the world of sports and guest interviews to gain a unique perspective.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 19 Memphis (16-4, 6-1) won three-straight games behind PJ Haggerty, who is second in the country in scoring with 22.1 ppg; Tulane (11-9, 5-2) is 9-2 at home, where the Green Wave have won the last three meetings with the Tigers.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: The latest news and updates surrounding the fighters competing in the upcoming UFC event are featured, breaking down the fight card with in-depth analysis of the premier matches highlighting the event, along with profiles of the combatants.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Yale (11-6, 4-0) won five-straight games behind John Poulakidas, who leads the Ivy League with 19.4 ppg; Princeton (14-5, 3-1) is 6-2 at home behind Xaivian Lee, who is fourth in the Ivy League with 17.2 ppg, and won the last two home meetings.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: San Jose State (10-11, 3-6) won three of its last four games after a 67-58 win over Wyoming behind 22 points from Latrell Davis; San Diego State (13-5, 6-3) is 6-3 at home behind Miles Byrd, who leads the Aztecs in scoring with 14.1 ppg.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: Each bowler in the eight-player field will have two minutes to throw as many strikes as possible with the player with the most strikes advancing to the next round; Akron's Chris Via, the No. 1 seed, is the defending champion; winner receives $30,000.

programme.title: 2025 Women's Concacaf U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Puerto Rico (1-0-0) secured a 3-0 triumph over St. Vincent/Grenadines on Jan. 27, as Gabriella Garnett notched a brace in the first half, while Cayman Islands (0-0-1) comes off a 2-0 loss to Bermuda in Week 1; inaugural meeting between the teams.

programme.title: 2025 Women's Concacaf U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Trinidad & Tobago (1-0-0) cruised to a 5-0 victory over the U.S. Virgin Islands, 5-0, in Week 1, as Orrielle Martin scored twice in each half to finish with four goals; Belize (0-0-1) comes off a 2-0 loss to Honduras in its Group B opener on Jan. 27.

programme.title: Mexican Liga MX Soccer
programme.desc: Jurez has claimed victories over Santos Laguna in three of their last four meetings, winning the most recent matchup on Oct. 6 with a 2-0 scoreline; scar Estupin and Carlos Salcedo found the net for Jurez in the win away from home.

programme.desc: Al-Nassr (10-5-2) is unbeaten over its last four contests; Al-Raed (4-2-11) is unbeaten in the past two meetings with Al-Alami after earning a 1-1 draw in Week 1, as Mohamed Fouzair scored the equalizer in the 49th minute off a penalty kick.
